page.title: 09FARMING - MILKING
page.content: First the farmer has to take food into the loft. When it is time for{milking he gets the cows into the parlour. When the first lot of cows are in he pulls the handle and some food comes down into the bins. Then the cows can eat while they are being milked. To milk the cows a{cluster}is put on the cows' udders. This is a tube with air being sucked through. Once the clusters are on, the milk will start coming into the milking jars and then into the tank. Once in the tank the milk is stirred and cooled. A tanker comes and takes the milk to a dried milk factory near Leominster. Afterwards all the milking apparatus has to be{sterilised,}and the loft refilled with food. Fewer dairy cows are now kept locally, because of the{EEC milk quota regulations of 1983.
